questions.title: Question 2
questions.text:
![](/content/media/elm-labelled-.webp)

The yellow arrow is pointing towards the most anterior hyper-reflective line in the outer retina. What layer of the retina is it pointing to?

answers.explanation:
The most anterior hyper-reflective line in the outer retina is the external limiting membrane (ELM). In this case, the ELM can only be identified in the perifoveal area. When traced outwards away from the fovea, the ELM cannot be identified, which is in keeping with the preferential loss of outer retinal morphology in this condition.

questions.title: Question 3
questions.text: What investigation should be performed next?

answers.explanation:
![](/content/media/retina-7-5.webp)

Cone dystrophies are diagnosed by an abnormal photopic ERG and a normal or near-normal rod-isolating ERG. The diagnosis of cone dystrophy is suggested by progressive loss of visual acuity and colour discrimination, often accompanied by hemeralopia (day blindness) and photophobia. Genetic testing can be performed to identify the causative mutation.
